values:
Keeping close tabs on my daily progress:
Date Time Spent Writing Word Count Give Up Yet?

Though I've known about NaNoWriMo for a few years now, (thanks to ), I have yet to participate in this writing challenge of olympic proportions. And frankly, after struggling through the monotony of a strict school/work routine for a year, I'm glad to have found something I hope will help me break from the schedule and add a little "flavor" to my mundane life. And if nothing else, it gives me an excuse to spend mindless hours wasting away on the computer, which is always a good thing. For the most part I plan to use this space as a sort of "desktop" for my pre-writing phase. I've got a lot of outlining and character development to work on, and this is most likely where I'll jumble together any brainstorming. HOWEVER, come November 30th, should I be lucky enough to have endured the challenge and accomplish writing my 50,000+ words, I'll be sure to post my work for all to read or comment upon. Will NaNoWriMo 2005 be the single event to send me off the edge? I guess we'll simply have to wait and see...
